tt:div.tt:p:
ARCHER: And so,
here is what I propose...

We finish these,
get some roadies,

head back to my huge penthouse,
drink chilled champagne served
by my valet...

ARCHER: Only if he's parking
your car,

then we slip into my new hot tub
and, ya know,
see where the evening takes us.

WOMAN: Well, I have to wait
until my friend comes back
from the powder room...

ARCHER: Well yeah,
obviously we're gonna wait for
her, she's the hot one.

ARCHER: I'm sorry,
is something funny?

MAN: Just that last part,
where she slapped you.

ARCHER: No,
I'm not oh -- oh my God!
BURT REYNOLDS: Yes, yes I am.

And if I let you up,
are you gonna do anything
stupid?

ARCHER: Yeah,
you've heard of me, huh?

BURT REYNOLDS: Well,
just from your --

ARCHER: Press clippings, yeah,
it's pretty hard to stay

anonymous when you're the
world's greatest secret agent.

BURT REYNOLDS: Calling yourself
that can't help.

ARCHER: Hang on, true story,
Operation CIA?

That movie's basically why I
became a secret agent in the
first place!

ARCHER: What's awful is I almost
punched you!

ARCHER: And I've seen all your
other movies like five times!

Sam Whiskey, Navajo Joe, Fuzz,
Hooper, Shamus, Shark,

The Longest Yard, Deliverance,
The Smokies, White Lightning,
obviously Gator, uh, oh!
I even saw At Long Last Love!
Listen, I kinda have a date.
ARCHER: No no no wait wait wait!

Sorry. Lemme buy you a drink,
I wanna tell you my idea for a
Gator sequel!

BURT REYNOLDS: Gator was
a sequel.

ARCHER: I Know,
and this will be the final
chapter in The McClusky Trilogy!

ARCHER: With twice as many
airboats as Gator!

BURT REYNOLDS: Twice as many
would be none?

ARCHER: What're you talking
about, Gator had --

ARCHER: I -- okay,
but this one has airboats,

and they're central to the plot,
BURT REYNOLDS: And it sounds

great, kid, but like I said,
I kinda have a date, so...

You gonna take her upstairs and
give her "the longest yard"?

MALORY: What are you
doing here? !

remember how I said I kinda had
a date?

Hope that's not
gonna be a problem.

Burt Reynolds didn't give you a
black eye, the floor did!

When you fainted like a
schoolgirl!

ARCHER: It was an involuntary
reaction, mother!

To seeing you all tarted
up to meet my hero in a hotel
bar for sex!

MALORY: Oh for -- we were
meeting for drinks!

I mean obviously sex was
implied, but --

MALORY: And since when
is he your hero?

YOUNG ARCHER: Eeeast bound and
doowwn!

MALORY: I thought that was
Richard Petty.

ARCHER: Which doesn't even merit
a response.

And you cannot date
Burt Reynolds!

MALORY: Can, am,
and will continue to do so.

ARCHER: I'm serious,
I'll do something drastic!

Mainly because you've got
bigger things to worry about.
ARCHER: I'll be the judge of --

a Cuban hit squad is
in New York to kill me? !
ARCHER: This intel's a week old!

Why are you just telling me
about it now? !

Pick up Sterling,
pick up, pick --

MALORY: And then I just sort of
forgot about it, because
that same night, I met --

MALORY: Burt dear,
what a lovely surprise!

BURT REYNOLDS: I'm sitting
here with just a mustache
and memories of last night.

BURT REYNOLDS: and also
a blanket.
The AC in my room's stuck on...

CHERYL/CAROL: Deliverance,
Gator,
and this is him in Cosmoooh!

PAM: I swear to God,
you could drown a toddler in my
panties right now.

I mean not that you would,
but --

MALORY: Go get my gray fox out
of cold storage.

Burt Reynolds is taking me to a
movie premiere tonight, so --

help me God,
if you throw that computer on

the floor again you'll wake up
in a mental ward with total

CYRIL: Archer, hey,
about this expense report --

Mother is ruining what remains
of my life before a Cuban hit
squad assassinates me, so --

ARCHER: You almost got shot in
the face.

Or because Burt Reynolds is
doing your mom?

CYRIL: You broke my frickin
nose!

ARCHER: What's that? Sorry,
I can't hear you over the sound
of I broke your nose!

LANA: Bullying Cyril isn't gonna
make Burt Reynolds stop
shtupping your mom.

LANA: But even if he is,
which he is --

LANA: This Cuban hit squad
is no joke.

So if I were you,
I'd lay low in the safehouse

LANA: I'm sorry,
your words made sense,
but your sarcastic tone did not.

ARCHER: Because there are
no Cubans!

Mother just wants me out of the
way so she can...

do unspeakable things with
Burt Reynolds!

LANA: I love it
that I'm the idiot...

MALORY: So unless the building
is literally on fire,
none of you are to call me.

Because, as I may
have mentioned --

MALORY: -- tonight I will be
attending a movie premiere with
Burt Reynolds.

CHERYL/CAROL: Oh my God,
that totally reminds me!

CHERYL/CAROL: That's how I knew
it was from him.

"Dear Malory, it's been --"
LANA: Dear Malory,

it's been real,
but I'm dumping you for a young

starlet and heading back to
Tinseltown.

LANA: Wait a -- who calls it
Tinseltown?

LANA: Or somebody who just
thinks that's what movie stars
call Hollywood.

LANA: Archer goes to Burt's
hotel room...

LANA: And then hides him
somewhere.

Like an idiot kid hiding
a lamp he broke.

PAM: You really think
he'd do that?

I'm serious,
if you ever go near to my mother
again I will...

BURT REYNOLDS: Well,
then you should probably just
go ahead and get it over with.

BURT REYNOLDS: Because if you
don't kill me, and I get loose?

You're gonna wish you were in
hell with your back broke.

MALORY: It's my own fault,
I should've known!

They tell you they love you,
and then they just cast you

aside when some young starlet
catches their eye,
with her perky little boobs!

CHERYL/CAROL: I bet they were
perky and big.

PAM: Why are you torturing her
like that? !

CHERYL/CAROL: Why are you asking
rhetorical questions?

KRIEGER: Aww, that's actually
kinda sad...

LANA: Allright, here's the plan,
I say we go rescue

Burt Reynolds, and as a bonus,
beat some sense into Archer's
head and ass.
Right in the head and ass!

LANA: So Pam, Carol,
stay here with Malory.

Everybody else,
let's go to Archer's.

GILLETTE: He's got a Cuban
hit squad after him.

Why wouldn't he go to the
safehouse?

LANA: A, because he thinks
they're imaginary, and B,
the safehouse doesn't have a --

Fifty jets,
hand-hewn California Redwood,
no big deal...

BURT REYNOLDS: The California
Redwood is endangered.

WOODHOUSE: Loved you
in Gone With The Wind.

ARCHER: Not him, shut up,
get him a drink.

BURT REYNOLDS: Well,
this whole thing's pretty odd.

Is you wanting to date
my mother!

BURT REYNOLDS: Beautiful, smart,
funny, successful...

ARCHER: Like, one of those,
tops.

BURT REYNOLDS: Not to mention
drop-dead sexy.

WOODHOUSE: I shall fetch
a cucumber!

ARCHER: You have to not date my
mother.

BURT REYNOLDS: Won't,
whatever, pick one.

ARCHER: Well then,
here's what's gonna happen.

You're gonna drink
your Pimm's Cup...

ARCHER: Then I'm gonna knock
you out,

and you're gonna wake up in a
mental hospital with total

BURT REYNOLDS: Hey, now there's
an idea for a movie!

ARCHER: Yeah,
I think it already was.
BURT REYNOLDS: I wasn't in it.

White walls, white sheets,
nurses in crisp white uniforms,

broken men shuffle like zombies
we see a hospital wristband on
a man's arm, John Doe.

And we slowly tilt up,
to see the man's face...

And he's looking out the window,
the afternoon sun on his face,

and there's a spark of
recognition in his eyes,

cause you know what
he's looking at?

ARCHER: There's a mental
hospital there?

BURT REYNOLDS: Right on the
water.

And guess what's tied up right
out there at the dock?

And the head nurse falls in
love with him and finds out who

he really is so she helps him
escape and they get chased by a

bunch of dirty cops but in the
end they win!

BURT REYNOLDS: And you just got
a screenplay credit.

BURT REYNOLDS: Oh yeah,
maybe even --
That would be a pimp cup, sir.

I hate to sound Hollywood,
but could you put my Pimm's Cup
in a --

It would be an honor,
Mr. Gable!

You're not gonna make that
movie!

BURT REYNOLDS: Oh,
I absolutely am.

And once your ISIS buddies
find out that you kidnapped me

and come find me,
I'm gonna give them all
an EP credit.

So drink your stupid
Pimm's Cup --

BURT REYNOLDS: Yeah,
where are we on that chalice?

ARCHER: Because nobody is coming
for you, Burt!

LANA: Okay,
don't take this the wrong way?

But I'm kinda wondering
how you're gonna be an
effective field agent.
CUBAN TWO: Creo que sí, pero...

GILLETTE: I mean don't get me
wrong, I'm all for
affirmative action, but --

LANA: Oh my God! Okay,
first of all --

First of all,
I was twice the agent you were

when your legs worked,
so don't hand me that --

LANA: And this conversation
isn't over!

GILLETTE: And now I do actually
see your point.

Krieger can't outrun anything
with all that handicapped shit.

But this conversation
is not over!

ARCHER: You think you can

BURT REYNOLDS: And I'll bet
on it.

BURT REYNOLDS: If I don't catch

ARCHER: Where they don't have
telephones to ever call my
mother again, ever.

ARCHER: You keep dating my
mother, yeah, got it.

And since we've wasted a
shitload of time already,

I feel pretty good about
this bet.

ARCHER: I know,
it drives me nuts.

It's like the world's slowest

but the co-op board was like

no assessment or anything.

ARCHER: Preaching to the choir,

Didn't know they sold those
to men.
ARCHER: Yeah, laugh it up, Burt.

BURT REYNOLDS: Don't you wanna

ARCHER: I don't care about them!

You just pretend you don't,

ARCHER: Dying in this frickin

LANA: You are such an asshole!

ARCHER: Lana? ! Lana,

where are you? !

Getting shot at

we're all the way acrawww

BURT REYNOLDS: He was part

BURT REYNOLDS: You know what

BURT REYNOLDS: You only see your

BURT REYNOLDS: Not sexual needs

all the stuff that makes a

And until you -- oops, hang on.

if you'd pay attention you might

I can't hear you over the sound
of my giant throbbing erection.
ARCHER: It's gone, I'm all ears.

oh wait, wait,

until you can look at your

And if I were you I'd come to

because I plan on seeing

ARCHER: What do you mean you

Ugh, listen,

And I, for one,

MALORY: Oh blow it out yer ass.
